quizlist.question: The private sector is more reliable and trustworthy than the public sector.
Single payer health care is fundamentally a good idea.
A flat tax is more fair than a progressive tax.
We must increase corporate regulations to curtail greenhouse gas emissions.
International free trade should be expanded.
K-12 education should be provided as a social service by the government.
Minority status should bear influence on opportunity.
Alternative schooling methods create unequal opportunity and should be abolished.
Government surveillance should be expanded to combat terrorism.
Marriage should not be regulated by the federal government.
Our country has a moral responsibility to maintain world peace, even if it requires military action.
Protectionism by means of tariffs, subsidies, import quotas, or other restrictions placed on the imports of foreign competitors are necessary to encourage home industry.
The money spent on the military would be better spent at home.
We must maintain strong ties with our allies, regardless of their actions.
People who live in a nondemocratic country would prefer to live in a democratic one.
